install.name: JE-Construct-Pro
install.author: Joomla Engineering
install.copyright: Copyright (C) 2010 Matt Thomas | Joomla Engineering. All rights reserved.
install.description:
• Joomla Engineering Construct
  • Features
  • Changelog

Getting Started:

Now that you've installed Construct, getting started is easy. The 40 included module positions occupy the most commonly used areas within a template. With dynamic width logic, the availability of two left and two right columns, the numerous module positions and expanded functionality via template parameters, building your unique Joomla website is greatly simplified with this framework. Once you have your content, components and modules in place, just add your unique style.

Adding your unique style is accomplished by adding a custom style sheet to the CSS directory located within this template (/templates/je-construct-pro/css/). Once created, just open this template in the Template Manager and select YES next to Use custom style sheet and select the one you added. There is also an example template pack included within this template’s installation archive to help you get you started; just extract the example template pack archive to this template’s directory.

Integrated mobile device detection ensures that all of your visitors get the content they desire. The included mobile sub-template is a great start for serving your mobile audience. It’s fast loading and easy to use design fita most devices well.

Allowing even greater flexablity of your design is the ability to add article, menu item, category, section and component specific CSS and sub-template files. Place these appropriately named files in the right folder and the template will load them automatically. For exmaple, to create a sub-template for article 37, add your new layout and CSS to the layouts/article directory and name the files article-37.php and article-37.css. You can even override the template's core layout by adding an alternate index.php file to the layouts/ directory.

Joomla 1.5 Template Development Framework © 2010 Joomla Engineering™

For more information and support, visit Joomla Engineering

This template features:

  • 40 collapsible module positions including two left and two right content columns.
  • Dynamic column widths.
  • Fluid max-width layout with dynamic image/object handling.
  • Font-family parameter option.
  • Google Font API parameter option for header font.
  • Automatic detection and loading of alternate component, section, category, item and article sub-templates.
  • Automatic detection and loading of component, section, category, item and article specific CSS files.
  • Parameterized automatic comprehensive detection of mobile devices and loading of mobile friendly sub-template.
  • Matching error page, with built in email notification and non-collapsible module rendering.
  • Matching offline page.
  • Example upgrade notification / version checker code.
  • Example code to disable Mootools.
  • Optional loading of jQuery.
  • Integrated IE CSS3 support and IE6 transparency/hover fixes.
  • Custom xhtml-style module chrome "jexhtml", with the ability to:
    • Assign header level.
    • Assign header class.
    • Add CSS3 rounded borders and drop shadows.
    • Add a class to the outer <div> (i.e <div class="moduletable gutter">).
  • Custom module chrome "jerounded", with the ability to:
    • Assign header level.
    • Assign header class.
    • Add a class to the outer <div> (i.e <div class="moduletable gutter">).
    • Assign flexible image based rounded corners (nested <div< method).
  • Table-less XHTML / CSS based code.
  • Table-less overrides with base CSS styles.
  • CSS based suckerfish navigation.
  • Parent item indicators for drop-down and fly-out menus.
  • SEO source ordered content.
  • Improved accessibility for screen-readers.
  • Fluid column widths based on a single outer fluid max-width.
  • Fluid media sizing.
  • Unobtrusive degradable ajax style sheet switcher.
  • On-page anchor links.
  • @font-face typography example.
  • "Component Only Index" file for splash and other module-free display applications.
  • CSS based sticky footer.
  • Optional full-width elements, such as header and footer.
  • CSS centered, left-aligned and right-aligned horizontal navigation styles.
  • Pre-configured modal pop-up example with modal template included.

1.5.349 - December 8th, 2010

  • Fixed typo in max-width style declaration.
  • Fixed sticky footer and label issues in offline.php.

1.5.340 - November 26th, 2010

  • Added article, category, component, item folders to CSS and modified logic.php to inspect those folders for asset specific CSS.
  • Moved all head elements to logic.php for unified usage and elimination of redundant code.
  • Modified modal.php and offline.php to reflect head elements move to logic.php.
  • Changed $document to $doc in error.php.
  • Removed custom style sheet from component.php.
  • Discontinued use of mssmarttagspreventparsing and http-equiv="imagetoolbar" meta tags.
  • Added offline mobile template parameter.

1.5.318 - November 19th, 2010

  • Moved layout overrides (sub-templates) to /layout/ folder, added support for core template layout override (Thanks Seth Warburton and Molajo!).
  • Changed loading of jQuery to use $doc->addScript (Thanks Seth Warburton and Molajo!).
  • Refactored method to remove MooTools (Thanks Seth Warburton and Molajo!).
  • Changed img, object {max-width:100%} to load conditionally dependant on max-width layout (Thanks Seth Warburton and Molajo!).
  • Updated error and offline pages to reflect changes.
  • Refactored templateDetails.xml to create layout directories without overwriting files to preserve overrides during upgrade.

1.5.316 - November 16th, 2010

  • Discontinued use of getVar in favor of more secure methods (Thanks Jeff Channel and Molajo!).
  • Changed double parenthesis to use white space instead (Thanks Stian Didriksen and Molajo!).
  • Removed unnecessary parenthesis from echo statement.

1.5.278 - November 8th, 2010

  • Relocated button, active menu item, active item trial and hover CSS to exmaple.css.
  • Refactrored head code to use single quotes where possible.
  • Changed style switch dependant style sheets to be included conditionally.
  • Corrected Opera issue with clearfix technique.
  • Added missing system message styles.
  • Removed extranous closing paragraph tag from breadcrumbs.

1.5.273 - November 4th, 2010

  • Refactored menu CSS for unified functionality and more condensed code.
  • Added wireframe alternate stylesheet as layout aid.
  • Moved content-left and content-right gutter divs.

1.5.258 - October 19th, 2010

  • Changed erroneous div id="content-right-1" to div id="right".
  • Removed float:left and width:90px from ol.form label.
  • Renamed .clr to .clear to avoid conflict with K2.

1.5.250 - October 14th, 2010

  • Added mod_breadcrumbs override.
  • Removed #breadcrumbs styles and added .breadcrumbs styles.
  • Minor code cleanup of single and double quote usage.

1.5.245 - October 14th, 2010

  • Replaced dirname( __FILE__ ) with JPATH_THEMES.'/'.$this->template. for increased security. (Thanks Molajo!)
  • Replaced include_once $file; with if(file_exists($file)) include_once $file;. (Thanks Molajo!)

1.5.244 - October 13th, 2010

  • Updated mobile detection script.

1.5.234 - October 11th, 2010

  • Converted IE6 transparency and IE CSS3 support to parameters.
  • Finalized example template pack.
  • Removed pre-defined module styles from index.php.

1.5.230 - October 6th, 2010

  • Added offline module position to offline page.
  • Finalized module position naming scheme.
  • Corrected CSS / JavaScript issue with IE6 Suckerfish/Fly-out Menu support in Nav, Content-left, Content-Right.

1.5.229 - October 5th, 2010

  • Revised image and object width expressions for IE6.
  • Added sub-template body class parameter.
  • Removed unused JavaScript files.
  • Misc code cleanup in supporting file headers.
  • Renamed included custom.css to example.css.
  • Revised RTL CSS.

1.5.225 - October 1st, 2010

  • Revised logic to match 1.5 sample data module position names.
  • Reverted module position naming to fit 1.5 sample data.
  • Added offile mobile optimized page.
  • Addded redirect of error page to home if offline.
  • Revised code layout of parameters and base URL.

1.5.221 - September 30th, 2010

  • Implemented new width parameters/
  • Implemented expanded support for IE6 and IE CSS3.
  • Fixed issue with IE6 / normal.css background color / PIE.htc conflict.

1.5.205 - September 28th, 2010

  • Added jQuery parameter.
  • Updated element names to mirror HTML5.
  • Added RTL missing support.
  • Updated error and offline templates to match new module scheme.
  • Specified more files in installer XML.
  • Revised custom style sheet parameter as file list type.

1.5.168 - September 20th, 2010

  • Added 24 module positions for a total of 40.
  • Added font-family parameter option.
  • Added Google Font API parameter option for header font style.
  • Revised module position naming scheme.
  • Revised layout logic to accomidate new module positions.
  • Revised templateDetails.xml to specify filenames for upgradability.

1.5.162 - September 17th, 2010

  • Added parameter to enable/disable sticky footer.
  • Fixed CSS issue with system messages.
  • Added CSS styles to button, input[type="submit"].

1.5.157 - August 24th, 2010

  • Added integrated version checker.
  • Reverted RokAjaxSearch Beez override workaround.

1.5.150 - August 17th, 2010

  • Depreciated use of DS as directory separator.

1.5.146 - August 13th, 2010

  • Added parameter based custom style sheet.
  • Added specific CSS and sub-template capability to modal template.
  • Removed version number from template name for possible folder naming issues.

1.5.134 - August 10th, 2010

  • Fixed column width spacing issue.
  • Added modal.css for convenience of modal base styles.

1.5.130 - August 9th, 2010

  • Added alternate CSS capability to modal.php.
  • Updated logic.php to include component specific CSS.
  • Updated CREDITS.php
  • Updated to latest rev of mdetect.php
  • Improved example sub-templates.

1.5.124 - July 22nd, 2010

  • Included workaround for conflict between RokAjaxSearch 1.9 and Beez com_content/article.default.php when using MooTools 1.2.

1.5.122 - July 17th, 2010

  • Added component specific sub-template capability.

1.5.98 - June 5th, 2010

  • Replaced image based rounded corners with CSS3 technique.
  • Remove jeoutline custom module chrome in favor of CSS3 techniques.

1.5.92 - May 19th, 2010

  • Added image based rounded corner feature.
  • Changed modules.php to contain three je styles of module chrome (jerounded, jeoutline, and jexhtml)

1.5.60 - May 14th, 2010

  • Paramterized mobile detection and mobile sub-template name.

Alpha Candidate - February 19th, 2010

Initial Build - January 25th, 2010

param.name: fontFamily
param.label: Font Family
param.description: The font family to be used.

param.name: googleHeaderFont
param.label: Google Header Font
param.description: The Google API font family to be used for headers. Visit http://code.google.com/webfonts for more information.

param.name: showDate
param.label: Date
param.description: Display today's date within the template.

param.name: showPageLinks
param.label: In-page Links
param.description: Display dynamically enabled in-page links that offer quick access to navigation, content, and sub-content areas.

param.name: enableSwitcher
param.label: Layout Aid
param.description: Enable the ajax style sheet switcher. Defaults to diagnostic and normal options for a visual layout aid.

param.name: showDiagnostics
param.label: Sub-template Diagnostics
param.description: Enable display of current article, item, category, section, component, and alias information for sub-template development.

param.name: useSubBodyClasses
param.label: Use Sub-template Body Classes
param.description: Enable to dynamically add body classes equl to the current sub-template.

param.name: siteWidth
param.label: Site Width
param.description: Define the overall width of the layout. Enter only a number, no units, as you will choose which unit to use below.

param.name: siteWidthType
param.label: Site Width Style
param.description: Set whether to use a fluid max-width or fixed width layout.

param.name: siteWidthUnit
param.label: Site Width Type
param.description: Choose to set the width in relative Ems, Pixels or percentage. Ems are calculated based on their parent element size, where the body font size is approximately 12px.

param.name: fullWidth
param.label: Full Width Elements
param.description: Should the header and footer expand to be the full width of the browser viewport or be constrained to the same width defined above.

param.name: useStickyFooter
param.label: Use CSS Sticky Footer
param.description: Enable the use a CSS Sticky Footer, which requires a fixed height. Dynamic content of varying sizes may require special attention when using this.

param.name: IECSS3
param.label: Add CSS3 Support to IE
param.description: Enable the use of PIE (http://css3pie.com/) to add CSS3 support to Internet Explorer version 8 and before. Also adds pie_hover class to non-link items on hover. For performance reason, you must define the tagret elements below.

param.name: IECSS3Targets
param.label: IE CSS3 Support Tragets
param.description: Enter a comma seprated list of HTML targets to apply PIE to.

param.name: IE6TransFix
param.label: Add IE6 Transparency Fix
param.description: Enable the use DD_belatedPNG (http://www.dillerdesign.com/experiment/DD_belatedPNG/) to add transparentcy support to IE6. For performance reason, you must define the tagret elements below.

param.name: IE6TransFixTargets
param.label: IE6 Transparency Fix Targets
param.description: Enter a comma seprated list of HTML targets to apply DD_belatedPNG to.

param.name: loadMoo
param.label: Load MooTools
param.description: Load the MooTools JavaScript library that is included with Joomla.

param.name: loadModal
param.label: Enable modal pop-ups
param.description: Load the SqueezeBox JavaScript for modals. Requires MooTools to be enabled.

param.name: loadjQuery
param.label: Load jQuery
param.description: Load the jQuery JavaScript library, version 1.4.2, hosted by Google.

param.name: mdetect
param.label: Mobile Device Detection
param.description: Enable automatic detecion of mobile devices and load a mobile friendly alternate sub-template.

param.name: mtemplate
param.label: Mobile Sub-template
param.description: Name of mobile friendly sub-template located within this templates' mobile folder. Default is mobile.php

param.name: mtemplateoffline
param.label: Offline Mobile Template
param.description: Name of offline mobile friendly sub-template located within this templates' mobile folder. Default is mobile-offline.php.

param.name: useCustomStyleSheet
param.label: Use custom style sheet
param.description: Enable to use a seperate stylesheet for your custom CSS declarations. HINT: Segregating custom styles will help you upgrade your copy of Construct if so desired.

param.name: customStyleSheet
param.label: Custom style sheet
param.description: Name of the style sheet that contains your custom CSS declarations. Default is custom.css.

param.name: setGeneratorTag
param.label: Generator Meta Tag
param.description: Customize the generator meta tag output by your template.
